Hello, I'm Adam Visokay

I am a computational social scientist studying at the University of Washington, advised by Professor Tyler McCormick. My research explores how to leverage artificial intelligence and machine learning to study social phenomena. I am particularly interested in how to perform valid statistical inference using predicted data. I love interdisciplinary projects and have past and ongoing collaborations with experts in Computer Science, Sociology, Economics, Public Pealth, and Medicine. My most recent work is featured in EMNLP and COLM. Can AI help us do better social science? I am exploring if so, how, and what are the limitations?

Education

M.A., Syracuse University, Economics 2017
B.A., University of Virginia, Economics and History, 2012-2016

Research Experience

Researcher, Center for Statistics and the Social Sciences
Research Assistant, Sciences Po

Languages

Programming: Python, R, Julia, postgreSQL, Java
